summary: This bill, the Yuhaaviatam of San Manuel Nation Land Exchange Act, proposes a land exchange between the U.S. government and the Yuhaaviatam of San Manuel Nation (a federally recognized tribe). The Secretary of Agriculture, through the Forest Service, would exchange approximately 1,475 acres of National Forest System land (Federal Land) for approximately 1,460 acres of land owned by the Nation (Non-Federal Land).  The bill outlines definitions, survey requirements, map adjustments, and specifies an agreement for the Nation to preserve the Arrowhead landmark site. The land acquired by the Secretary will become part of the San Bernardino National Forest.
